p: Persistence of pseudomembrane can lead to subepithelial fibrosis of the conjunctival mucosa, symblepharon formation, and punctal occlusion. 1 Thus, rare cases may require repair of the fornix and associated lid anatomy defect (entropion or ectropion). Furthermore, streptococcal co-infection may be present in severe cases, with membranes that can precipitate corneal perforation and necessitate treatment. 95
